There are daily transports by plane or ferry from Suva to Levuka -
transport to Silana can be by taxi from

town anytime you want. This takes about 30 min, cost is approximately F$ 20.

Alternatively, for the real Fiji experience take the local carrier and travel as the Fijians do. Departs around noon and around 4 PM, cost is F$ 3 and its takes as long until you there.

value: The ruins of the Bure Kalou (temple of spiritual worship) and ancient Tribal grounds up high on the hill

Relax, swim, snorkel, kayak, sunbathe, go hiking up the mountains to see ancient ruins, wander around the local village and see what life is like, go fishing, ......
Local fare including Lovo - a traditional Fijian meal cooked slowly in the ground.

value: content=Arovudi, reached by taxi or carrier from Levuka, Tentsites dorm and cottages available near white coral sand beach, Price from F$20pp.

This is a great out of the way place.  Next to Aravudi, on the opposite side of Ovalau to the historic Leveka town.  Authentic cheap food cooked by Seru and Sala.  The beach is fine white coral, with great snorkelling right out front.

Accommodation options with shared facilities include tents, dorm or cottage.  There is also a self contained cottage available. This place is a must if you want to stay of the tourist trail with plenty to do including relaxing.
